data.title: Awards received
data.text:
1983

Texas Association of Spanish Announcers (TASA) Zenzontli Award: New Female Vocalist

Awarded plaque for "Outstanding Performer" from Maximo's in Corpus Christi

1984

Appreciation Award: Movida Band Productions for work with Toys For Tots

1985

* Tejano Music Awards

o Nominated "Female Entertainer of the Year"- lost to Laura Canales

o Nominated "Female Vocalist of the Year"- lost to Laura Canales

o Los Dinos nominated for "Most Promising Band"- lost to La Sombra

1985

* Tejano Music Awards

o Nominated "Female Entertainer of the Year"- lost to Laura Canales

o Nominated "Female Vocalist of the Year"- lost to Laura Canales

o Los Dinos nominated for "Most Promising Band"- lost to La Sombra

1986

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

* West Texas Hispanic Music Awards

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

o Nominated "Album of the Year" for 'Alpha'

o Nominated "Hit Song of the Year" for 'Dame Un Beso'

o Los Dinos nominated for "Best Showband of the Year"

* KFLZ Awards

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

1987

* Tejano Music Awards

o Nominated "Album of the Year" for 'Alpha'- lost to "Cuantas Veces" by David Lee Garza Y Los Musicales

o Nominated "Song of the Year" for 'Dame Un Beso'- lost to "Si Tu Supieras" by La Mafia

o Nominated "Single of the Year" for 'Dame Un Beso'- lost to "Entre Mas Lejos Me Vaya" by David Marez

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

o Finalist "Female Entertainer of the Year"- lost to Patsy Torres

o Los Dinos Finalist "Most Promising Band of the Year"- lost to Fandango USA

* Mike Chavez Awards

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

o Los Dinos nominated "Most Promising Band"

o Los Dinos nominated "Keyboard Group of the Year"

o Nominated "Keyboard Album of the Year" for 'A Million To One'

o Nominated "Keyboard Single of the Year" for 'A Million To One'

o Nominated "Keyboard Single of the Year" for 'Mu√±equito de Trapo'

* KFlZ Awards

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

o Won Kuno's People's Choice Awards

1988

* Tejano Music Awards

o Nominated for "Single of the Year" for 'Terco Corazon'- lost to "Amor Querido" by Ramiro "Ram" Herrera

o Nominated for "Album of the Year" for 'And the Winner Is...'- lost to "Dejame Quererte" by David Lee Garza Y Los Musicales

o A.B. III nominated for "Songwriter of the Year"- lost to Luis Silva

o Won "Female Entertainer of the Year"

1989

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Entertainer of the Year"

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

1990

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Entertainer of the Year"

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

1991

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Entertainer of the Year"

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

1992

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Entertainer of the Year"

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

* Citation of Achievement presented to Five Candle Music by BMI

o For "Como La Flor","La Carcacha", and "Que Creias" in recognition of her great national popularity as measured by broadcast performers

o Abraham Quintanilla III for "Como La Flor","La Carcacha", and "Que Creias" in recognition of the great national popularity as measured by broadcast performers

1993

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Entertainer of the Year"

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

o Won "Album of the Year-Orchestra" for "Entre a Mi Mundo"

* Univision Premio Lo Nuestro

o Won "Album of the Year" for Entre A Mi Mundo"

o Won "Song of the Year" for "Como La Flor"

o A.B. Quintanilla III and Pete Astudillo won "Songwriters of the Year"

* ACE Award in New York

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

* Billboard's Number One

o Latin Artist

o Latin Album "Entre A Mi Mundo

* Citation of Achievement by BMI

o Presented to Abraham Quintanilla III for "Que Creias"

* Grammys

o Won "Best Mexican-American Album" for "Selena Live!"

NOTE: Selena was the only Tejano artist ever to received a Grammy.

1994

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Entertainer of the Year"

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

o Won "Album of the Year-Orchestra" for "Selena Live!"

1995

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Entertainer of the Year"mbvkv

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

o Won "Album of the Year-Orchestra" for "Amor Prohibido"

o Won "Record of the Year" for "Amor Prohibido"

o Won "Song of the Year" for "Bidi Bidi Bom Bom"

o Won "Tejano Crossover Song of the Year" for "Techno Cumbia"

* Grammys

o Nominated "Best Mexican-American Performance" for "Amor Prohibido"- lost to Vicki Carr

* Premio Lo Nuestro

o Won "Female Artist of the Year-Pop"

o Won "Female Artist of the Year-Regional/Mexican"

o Won "Album of the Year-Regional/Mexican" for "Amor Prohibido"

o A.B. III & Pete Astudillo won "Song (Artist/Songwriter) of the Year-Regional/Mexican" for "Amor Prohibido"

* Senate of Texas clared Selena's birthday as a holiday, when she would've turned 24.

1996

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Entertainer of the Year"

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

o Won Album of the Year - "Dreaming Of You"

o Won Song of the year - "Tu, Solo, Tu"

o Won Show Band of the Year - "Selena Y Los Dinos"

o Won Tejano Crossover - "I Could Fall In Love"

o Won Single of the Year - "Amor Prohibido

1997

* Tejano Music Awards

o Won "Female Vocalist of the Year"

o Won Song of the Year - "Siempre Hace Frio"

o Won Tejano Crossover - "No Quiero Saber"

2001

* Tejano Music Awards

o "Selena" Lifetime Achievement presented to Abraham Quintanilla III
